antiPatterns.name: On-Line Only
antiPatterns.description: Batch mode application parts are actively avoided in a service-oriented system, even though parts of the system like long running tasks would be primed for a batch system.
antiPatterns.context: A batch system needs to be integrated into a service-oriented environment. This can e.g. be a legacy application or a system for long running transactions.
antiPatterns.consequences: Solutions avoiding this integration can be expensive and unstable.
antiPatterns.cause: A prejudice exists that integrating batch applications in a service-oriented system is an obsolete technique.
antiPatterns.solution: Implement a classic data store and wrap it as a service. The data store is filled by batch subsystems and used interactively by other services.
